title: Cybersecurity Fundamentals Quiz
description: Test your knowledge of basic cybersecurity concepts, threats, and best practices. This quiz covers essential topics including phishing, password security, malware, encryption, and network security.

options.text: A type of malware that encrypts your files
A social engineering attack that tricks users into revealing sensitive information
A hardware device used to protect networks
A method of encrypting network traffic

questions.text: Which of the following is the STRONGEST password?

options.text: Password123
qwerty2024
T$9mK#pL@2xR!vN8
MyBirthday1990
HyperText Transfer Protocol Secure
High Transfer Protocol System
HyperText Transmission Protection Service
Hosting Transfer Protocol Standard

questions.text: Which of the following are common types of malware? (Select all that apply)

options.text: Trojan Horse
Ransomware
Firewall
Spyware
VPN
Using two different passwords for the same account
A security process requiring two different authentication methods to verify identity
Logging in from two different devices simultaneously
Having two user accounts on the same system

questions.text: What is the primary purpose of a firewall?

options.text: To encrypt data stored on hard drives
To create backup copies of important files
To monitor and control incoming and outgoing network traffic
To scan for viruses in email attachments

questions.text: Which protocol is used to securely transfer files over a network?

options.text: HTTP
FTP
SFTP
SMTP
A method to optimize database queries
An attack that inserts malicious SQL code into application queries
A technique for backing up databases
A way to encrypt database connections

questions.text: What does VPN stand for and what is its main purpose?

options.text: Virtual Private Network - creates a secure encrypted connection over the internet
Verified Protection Network - verifies user identities before network access
Virtual Public Network - provides public access to private resources
Variable Port Network - changes network ports dynamically for security

questions.text: Which of these practices help prevent security breaches? (Select all that apply)

options.text: Regular software updates and patches
Using the same password for all accounts
Employee security awareness training
Disabling antivirus to improve performance
Regular security audits and penetration testing
Storing passwords in plain text files
